intro: Baeckea crispiflora var. tenuior, commonly known as the slender leaf baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It is often found in regions of New South Wales and Queensland, where it thrives in well-drained environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and floral display.
